title: Bill Perkins (footballer, born 1876)
text:
William Perkins (28 January 1876 - c. 1940) was a <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="goalkeeper%20%28association%20football%29">goalkeeper</a> who notably played for <a href="Liverpool%20F.C.">Liverpool</a> in the late 19th and early 20th centuries.
Life and playing career.
Perkins played for <a href="Kettering%20Town%20F.C.">Kettering</a> and <a href="Luton%20Town%20F.C.">Luton Town</a> before being signed by Liverpool on 25 March 1899, making his senior debut on 3 April 1899 in a <a href="Football%20League%20Division%20One">Football League Division One</a> match against <a href="Newcastle%20United%20F.C.">Newcastle</a> at <a href="Anfield">Anfield</a>, a game that the Reds won 3–2.
Perkins became the Reds number 1 when he took over from <a href="Matt%20McQueen">Matt McQueen</a>, who had often played in outfield positions. <a href="Harry%20Storer%2C%20Sr.">Harry Storer</a> started the first 11 games during the <a href="1899%E2%80%931900%20Football%20League">1899-00 season</a> but Perkins took over and remained first choice until 1903 when he shared the duties with <a href="Peter%20Platt">Peter Platt</a>. Perkins was an ever present between the sticks when Liverpool won their first ever <a href="Football%20League%20First%20Division">Football League First Division</a> title in <a href="1900%E2%80%9301%20Football%20League">1900–01</a>.
After leaving Liverpool he joined <a href="Northampton%20Town%20F.C.">Northampton Town</a> of the <a href="Southern%20Football%20League">Southern League</a>.
